SEARCH
Package spaceInvaders.View

Class GameView

java.lang.Object
processing.core.PApplet
spaceInvaders.View.GameView
All Implemented Interfaces:
processing.core.PConstants, IGameView
public class GameView extends processing.core.PApplet implements IGameView
The GameView class is responsible for rendering the game's graphical interface using Processing.
Version:
1.0
Author:
MD Amanullah

  • Field Details

    • controller

      private IGameController controller
      The game controller responsible for managing game logic.

    • startScreenImage

      private processing.core.PImage startScreenImage
      Images used in the game: - startScreenImage: The image displayed at the start of the game. - playerImage: The image representing the player character. - starImage: The image representing stars in the background. - enemyImage: The image representing the enemy character. - gameOverScreenImage: The image displayed at the end of the game.

    • playerImage

      private processing.core.PImage playerImage
      Images used in the game: - startScreenImage: The image displayed at the start of the game. - playerImage: The image representing the player character. - starImage: The image representing stars in the background. - enemyImage: The image representing the enemy character. - gameOverScreenImage: The image displayed at the end of the game.

    • starImage

      private processing.core.PImage starImage
      Images used in the game: - startScreenImage: The image displayed at the start of the game. - playerImage: The image representing the player character. - starImage: The image representing stars in the background. - enemyImage: The image representing the enemy character. - gameOverScreenImage: The image displayed at the end of the game.

    • enemyImage

      private processing.core.PImage enemyImage
      Images used in the game: - startScreenImage: The image displayed at the start of the game. - playerImage: The image representing the player character. - starImage: The image representing stars in the background. - enemyImage: The image representing the enemy character. - gameOverScreenImage: The image displayed at the end of the game.

    • gameOverScreenImage

      private processing.core.PImage gameOverScreenImage
      Images used in the game: - startScreenImage: The image displayed at the start of the game. - playerImage: The image representing the player character. - starImage: The image representing stars in the background. - enemyImage: The image representing the enemy character. - gameOverScreenImage: The image displayed at the end of the game.

    • font

      private processing.core.PFont font
      Font used for displaying text in the game.

    • starX

      private float[] starX
      Arrays to store star positions and speeds: - starX: X-coordinates of stars. - starY: Y-coordinates of stars. - starSpeeds: Speeds of stars.

    • starY

      private float[] starY
      Arrays to store star positions and speeds: - starX: X-coordinates of stars. - starY: Y-coordinates of stars. - starSpeeds: Speeds of stars.

    • starSpeeds

      private float[] starSpeeds
      Arrays to store star positions and speeds: - starX: X-coordinates of stars. - starY: Y-coordinates of stars. - starSpeeds: Speeds of stars.

    • numStars

      private int numStars
      Number of stars in the background.

    • showInfoScreen

      private boolean showInfoScreen
      Flag to indicate whether the information screen is currently being displayed. It is set to true when the "Game Info" button is clicked and set to false either when the "Back" button is clicked or when the spacebar is pressed.

    • gameInfoButtonX

      private final int gameInfoButtonX
      The X-coordinate for the "Game Info" button's position on the screen. This determines where the button is placed horizontally.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • gameInfoButtonY

      private final int gameInfoButtonY
      The Y-coordinate for the "Game Info" button's position on the screen. This determines where the button is placed vertically.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • backButtonX

      private final int backButtonX
      The X-coordinate for the "Back" button's position on the information screen. This determines where the button is placed horizontally. Adjust this value if the button appears off-screen due to canvas size.

    • backButtonY

      private final int backButtonY
      The Y-coordinate for the "Back" button's position on the information screen. This determines where the button is placed vertically.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • buttonWidth

      private final int buttonWidth
      The width of the interactive buttons ("Game Info" and "Back") displayed on the screen.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • buttonHeight

      private final int buttonHeight
      The height of the interactive buttons ("Game Info" and "Back") displayed on the screen.
      See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • GameView

      public GameView()
      Default constructor for the GameView class. This constructor initializes the GameView object.

  • Method Details

    • settings

      public void settings()
      Configures the size and pixel density of the game window.
      Overrides:
      settings in class processing.core.PApplet

    • setup

      public void setup()
      Initializes the game view by loading images, setting the font, and initializing stars.
      Overrides:
      setup in class processing.core.PApplet

    • loadImages

      private void loadImages()
      Loads game images including start screen, player, enemy, star, and game over screen. Displays an error message if there is an issue loading any image.

    • initStars

      private void initStars()
      Initializes the starry background by creating arrays for star positions and speeds. Randomly generates initial positions and speeds for stars.

    • draw

      public void draw()
      Renders the game's graphical interface based on the current game state. This method is called repeatedly and is responsible for the main game loop rendering. The method performs the following actions: - Updates the game state by calling controller.updateGame(). - Checks the current game state (info screen, game running, paused, game over, or start screen) and renders the appropriate screen. - The rendering for each state is handled by separate methods: drawInfoScreen(), drawGame(), drawPausedScreen(), drawGameOverScreen(), and drawStartScreen(). - In the case of the start screen, it additionally renders the "Game Info" button. - Exception handling is implemented to catch and report errors that occur during the rendering process.
      Overrides:
      draw in class processing.core.PApplet

    • drawGameInfoButton

      private void drawGameInfoButton()
      Draws the "Game Info" button on the screen. This method is responsible for rendering a rectangular button with the text "Game Info". The button is drawn at a predefined position on the screen, with specific width and height, and a set color scheme. The method performs the following actions: - Sets the fill color for the button's background (orange color in this case). - Draws a rectangle at the specified position (gameInfoButtonX, gameInfoButtonY) with the specified dimensions (buttonWidth, buttonHeight). - Sets the fill color for the text (black in this case). - Adjusts the text size to 16. - Sets the text alignment to center. - Draws the text "Game Info" centered within the button. The position and size of the button are determined by the gameInfoButtonX, gameInfoButtonY, buttonWidth, and buttonHeight variables.

    • drawInfoScreen

      private void drawInfoScreen()
      Draws the information screen which displays the game instructions and a "Back" button. This screen is shown when the "Game Info" button is pressed and provides the player with details on how to play the game, including controls and gameplay mechanics. The method performs the following actions: - Sets a background color for the information screen. - Defines the text color (white) and size (16) for the main instruction text. - Aligns the text to the top-left corner and displays the gameplay instructions hardcoded within the method. - Changes the text color to green and increases the size to 32 for an additional message, guiding the player to press SPACE to return to the game start screen. - Draws a "Back" button that allows the player to return to the main game screen. This button is positioned at the top right of the screen and is styled with a specific color, size, and label. The method ensures the text and the "Back" button are clearly visible and easy to interact with, enhancing the user experience in understanding the game mechanics.

    • mousePressed

      public void mousePressed()
      Handles mouse press events within the game view. This method overrides the mousePressed method from the PApplet class. It is called whenever the mouse is pressed and is responsible for handling interactions with the "Game Info" and "Back" buttons. When the "Game Info" button is clicked, it toggles the visibility of the information screen, displaying or hiding the game instructions. The method checks if the mouse coordinates are within the bounds of the "Game Info" button to determine if it has been clicked. Similarly, when the "Back" button is clicked on the information screen, it hides the information screen and returns to the main game view. The method checks if the mouse coordinates are within the bounds of the "Back" button to determine if it has been clicked.
      Overrides:
      mousePressed in class processing.core.PApplet

    • drawGame

      private void drawGame()
      Draws the game elements including the starry background, player, bullets, enemy, enemy bullets, and star (if exists). Also displays the player's score and lives, and the enemy's score and lives.

    • drawStarryBackground

      private void drawStarryBackground()
      Draws the starry background with moving stars. It updates the position of stars and redraws them.

    • drawStartScreen

      private void drawStartScreen()
      Draws the start screen using the provided start screen image.

    • drawPlayer

      private void drawPlayer()
      Draws the player character at its current position.

    • drawEnemy

      private void drawEnemy()
      Draws the enemy character at its current position.

    • drawBullets

      private void drawBullets()
      Draws bullets fired by the player. Each bullet is represented as an ellipse.

    • drawEnemyBullets

      private void drawEnemyBullets()
      Draws bullets fired by the enemy. Each bullet is represented as an ellipse.

    • drawStar

      private void drawStar()
      Draws the star object if it exists in the game.

    • displayScoreAndLives

      private void displayScoreAndLives()
      Displays the player's current score and remaining lives on the screen.

    • displayEnemyScoreAndLives

      private void displayEnemyScoreAndLives()
      Displays the enemy's current score and remaining lives on the screen.

    • drawPausedScreen

      private void drawPausedScreen()
      Draws the "Game Paused" message at the center of the screen when the game is paused.

    • drawGameOverScreen

      private void drawGameOverScreen()
      Draws the game over screen with the winner's name and final score.

    • keyPressed

      public void keyPressed()
      Called when a key is pressed. Delegates the key event to the game controller.
      Overrides:
      keyPressed in class processing.core.PApplet

      public void updateView()
      This method is left empty as it is part of the interface contract. It does not have any specific functionality in this class.
